body:
About the UnserializeableWarning, what's the behavior from the PR when pandas `_repr_table_schema_` fails?

For background, some DataFrames just can't be serialized according to the table schema spec. In these cases, we'd ideally fall back to `_repr_html_`.

> For background, some DataFrames just can't be serialized according to the table schema spec. In these cases, we'd ideally fall back to _repr_html_.

Oh neat, it looks like it falls back to the next formatter. That's perfect.

So we can just get rid of the `UnserializableWarning` altogether then (I added it just for this). I can take care of that if you want.

> About the UnserializeableWarning, what's the behavior from the PR when pandas _repr_table_schema_ fails?

You'll get a traceback (not user-mute-able like a warning) with the failure and other reprs will still display. If that's okay, I'll just remove the warning.
@minrk I did those minor fixes. Thanks for putting this together. Feels much better than monkey patching :)
